artefact: Become an approved building inspector (England and Wales)

artefact.overview: How to become an individual or corporate approved building inspector
artefact.licence_short_description:
If you want to become an approved building inspector, you must apply to the Construction Industry Council (CIC) for registration.

*[CIC]: Construction Industry Council
artefact.licence_overview:
$!If you want to become an approved building inspector, you must apply to the Construction Industry Council (CIC) for registration.$!

You can apply to be either an individual approved inspector or a corporate approved inspector (part of a company).

##Restrictions

You must not have any professional or financial interest in the building work you supervise.

##Conditions

You must agree to follow the CIC Code of conduct for approved inspectors.

$D
[Download 'CIC Code of conduct for approved inspectors' (PDF, 69KB)](http://www.cic.org.uk/services/CodeofConduct.pdf  "Download 'CIC code of conduct for approved inspectors' (PDF, 69KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D


You should have knowledge of the Building Control Performance Standards, or 'Green Book'.

$D
[Download 'Building Control Performance Standards' (PDF, 163KB)](http://www.planningportal.gov.uk/uploads/br/bcpi/building-control-performance-standards_june06.pdf "Download 'Building Control Performance Standards' (PDF, 163KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

You must also meet [CIC insurance requirements.](http://www.cic.org.uk/services/ai_insurance.shtml "CIC-approved building inspector insurance requirements"){:rel="external"}

##How to apply

s1. You (or your company) must complete an application form giving full details of your qualifications and experience.
s2. If selected, you will be asked to attend a panel interview and do a 10-minute presentation. 
s3. If you're approved, you'll get a certificate of registration, which is valid for 5 years. 
s4. After 5 years you must apply for re-approval and follow the same process as before.


The [Construction Industry Council (CIC) website](http://www.cic.org.uk/services/ai_Howto.shtml "Construction Industry Council"){:rel="external"}  has information on becoming an approved building inspector and application forms.


$C**Construction Industry Council**  
020 7399 7400$C

##Licence fees

You will need to pay:

* an application fee of £3,500 (plus VAT) the first time you apply and when you apply for re-approval
* a yearly registration fee of £500 once you are approved


@Fact-checkers: is this application fee refundable if you're unsuccessful?@

 

*[VAT]: Value Added Tax
*[CIC]: Construction Industry Council

apply.introduction: Construction Industry Council has been designated by government as a body for approving inspectors. Individual and Corporate Approved Inspectors registered with CIC are qualified to undertake building control work in accordance with section 49 of the Building Act 1984 and regulation 4 of the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.) Regulations 1985, and the Building (Approved Inspectors etc.) Regulations 2010.
